Nominate.definition: having a special or certain name compare innominate [nÄ -mə-nāt] vt -nat·ed -nat·ing 1
Nominate.origin: [Latin nominatus , past participle of nominare to call by name, from nomin- nomen name]

1.definition: to appoint or propose for appointment to an office, position, or place [if the testator hasan executor of the will] [the President…shall and by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, shall appoint ambassadors "art. II"]
1.nominated: an executor of the will] [the President…shall and by and with the advice and consent of the Senate, shall appoint ambassadors "

2.definition: to propose as a candidate for election to office
